name: fps
description: Frames per second for video generation
impact: Higher FPS creates smoother motion but requires more computation. 24-30 fps is ideal for most use cases

name: duration
impact: Longer videos may have reduced consistency. 2-4 seconds typically yields best results

name: resolution
impact: Higher resolution provides more detail but increases generation time and file size

name: motion_strength
description: Controls the amount of motion in generated video
impact: Higher values create more dynamic movement but may reduce stability

name: consistency_weight
impact: Higher values maintain better consistency but may limit motion variety

name: guidance_scale
description: How closely to follow the text prompt
impact: Higher values follow prompt more closely but may reduce video quality

name: seed
description: Random seed for reproducible results (-1 for random)
impact: Set to specific value for reproducible outputs, -1 for variation

name: num_inference_steps
impact: More steps generally improve quality but increase generation time
